>>Weather Zagreb

The climate here is considered warm and temperate. In Zagreb, precipitation is notable throughout the entirety of the year, with even its most arid month still experiencing a considerable amount of rainfall. This location is classified as Cfa by Köppen and Geiger. The average annual temperature is 11.6 °C | 53.0 °F in Zagreb. The annual precipitation in this location is approximately 917 mm | 36.1 inch.

The designated area is positioned within the northern hemisphere of our globe. The warm and pleasant days of the Summer season commence towards the conclusion of June and come to an end in September. This particular period includes a span of months, namely: June, July, August, September.

Climate graph // Weather by Month Zagreb

In January, the precipitation level plummets to a mere 54 mm | 2.1 inch. This month holds the title for being exceptionally arid. The maximum quantity of rainfall is observed during the month of September, exhibiting an average value of 98 mm | 3.9 inch.

average temperature by month Zagreb

The month of highest temperature is July during which the average temperature reaches up to 22.5 °C | 72.5 °F. During the month of January, there is a notable drop in temperature, with an average low of approximately 0.5 °C | 32.9 °F.

The precipitation variance between the months with the lowest and highest levels of rainfall is 44 mm | 2 inch. The degree of fluctuation in the yearly temperature is approximately 22.0 °C | 39.5 °F.

In terms of relative humidity, the month that exhibits the highest level is December with a percentage of 63.66. Conversely, August has been recorded as having the lowest amount of relative humidity at only 63.66. It is noteworthy that May has the highest number of rainy days, amounting to 11.97, whereas the month with the least rainfall is February, experiencing only 8.47 wet days.

Hours of sunshine in Zagreb

avg. hours of sun

Total hours of sun

On average, the location of Zagreb records the highest number of daily sunshine hours during July. The mean duration of sunlight per day in this month is approximately 11.8, with a total cumulative count reaching up to 365.93.

On average, Zagreb records the lowest daily sunshine hours in January. During this period, there is an average of 4.1 hours of sunlight per day and a total accumulation of 127.02 hours.

Throughout the year, a total of 2849.1 hours of light are recorded in the location of Zagreb. The monthly average for sunlight is approximately 93.51 hours.
